byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers reported from aboard the Alex Haley; Washington; Kotzebue and Barrow, Alaska; and Moscow and Murmansk, Russia. Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Colorado Springs; James Hill from Murmansk; and Nikolay Khalip from Moscow.

abstract: Many analysts, government officials and members of Congress feel United States is lagging behind other nations in preparing for changes in environmental, economic and geopolitical realities of resource-rich Arctic region; Russia has significantly increased both its military presence and infrastructure in the Arctic, while US has yet to establish any meaningful foothold.
lead_paragraph: With warming seas creating new opportunities at the top of the world, nations are scrambling over the Arctic. But Russia may be beating the United States to the punch.

headline.main: U.S. Is Playing Catch-Up With Russia in Scramble for the Arctic
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Playing Catch-Up in Scramble for the Arctic

snippet: With warming seas creating new opportunities at the top of the world, nations are scrambling over the Arctic. But Russia may be beating the United States to the punch.
